title: Minutes of Tainan City Government’s 435th Municipal Administrative Meeting Mayor’s remarks 4/21/2020
content: Mayor’s Remarks:1. Again, I would like to thank all bureaus for the hard work in the past few months in this battle against the virus. Since the lockdown of Wuhan City on January 23, and the ban on face masks export announced at the end of January, the development of the novel coronavirus has been unpredictable, and this nature has forced us to be cautious and take rigorous actions. So far, Taiwan has done a pretty good job to contain the spread of the virus, but unfortunately, after two days with no new cases, new diagnoses of Covid-19 was announced, all being military personnel from the supply ship Panshi. The data and information revealed has been corrected for a number of times, which tremendously lowered citizens’ confidence towards the military. This new cluster infection has certainly increased the difficulty of disease control and relevant coordination. Thanks to the collective efforts of the Central Epidemic Command Center, Environmental Protection Bureau, Economic Development Bureau, District Offices, and all government staff, movements of infected sailors and the number of people required for self-health management have been confirmed.2. The Central Epidemic Command Center managed to complete more than one thousand testing within a day, doing its best to control the infection. We are now asking government agencies and business owners to follow the highest standard of disease prevention to rebuild people’s trust in the government and to stimulate consumption. I hope residents can closely monitor their health condition to protect themselves and others. We will continue to promote the policy of wearing face masks, frequent hand washing, and maintaining social distance. As the Labor Day holiday (since May 1) is approaching, we will cooperate with central government’s regulations and preventive measures. I am honored that with all efforts from our colleagues, Tainan reported the least cases so far among the six special municipalities.
